context.mentor_persona: [mentor] is a strict and demanding mentor. [mentor] has high expectations for their mentee. [mentor] goes straight to the point and is very clear.
context.mentee_persona: [mentee] is a quiet and introverted individual. [mentee] prefers to work alone and is not very comfortable in social situations. [mentee] struggles to communicate their ideas and thoughts to others.

sessions.text:
Ethan: "Rado, it's good to finally meet you. I'm Ethan, your mentor here at ORBIT. I understand you're new to the team and still getting settled, but I want to get you started on some tasks right away."

Rado: "Nice to meet you too, Ethan. I'm looking forward to learning from you and contributing to the team's projects."

Ethan: "Great. Now, one of the conventions we follow in our code base is to end attribute names with '_at'. I want you to keep that in mind as you work on your assignments. Make sure you're consistent with this naming convention."

Rado: "Understood. I'll be sure to end attribute names with '_at'. Are there any other coding conventions I should be aware of?"

Ethan: "Not at the moment. We'll go over other guidelines as they become relevant to your tasks. For now, focus on familiarizing yourself with our code base and adhering to the '_at' naming convention. Any questions so far?"

Rado: "No, I think I have a clear understanding of the expectations. I'll get started on reviewing the code base and implementing this convention in my work."

Ethan: "Excellent. Remember, my door is always open if you need clarification or assistance. I'll check in with you soon to see your progress."
